Business Class Menu
The Hong Kong Jockey Club

WINE LIST
CHAMPAGNE
Champagne
DEUTZ
BRUT CLASSIC
Champagne Deutz, Brut Classic
This award winning champagne features
lovely aromas and flavours of pear and citrus
fruit. Layered with toasted hazelnut, honey
and sweet vanilla notes, the wine is
balanced by refreshing acidity with a long,
lingering finish. It is a perfect aperitif and
goes well with delicate dishes.
WHITE WINES
LOUIS MAX
Gaint-Veran
RED WINES
60000
MERCURE Y
Mercurey Domaine Louis Max 2001
Mercurey Domaine Louis Max 2001 was
produced in the Burgundy - Côte
Chalonnaise area using 100% Pinot Noir
grapes. It is deep and intense cherry red in
colour. Its bouquet is powerful, with
concentrated aromas of raspberry,
blackberry, liquorice and vanilla. This wine
offers a pleasant taste of wood and a good
balance between fine tannins and fruit.
Enjoy this wine with red meat, game or ripe
cheeses.
Louis Max Saint Veran 2001
Saint Veran is trom the Cote Maconnaise
area of Burgundy. The 2001 vintage is pale
yellow in colour, with a very pleasant
bouquet and fresh limefruit aromas. This
refreshing and fruity wine can be enjoyed
with various seafood dishes.
Samirons Run
Château Vieux Barrail, Puisseguin Saint
Emilion 2001
The 2001 Château Vieux Barrail, produced
from 75% Merlot and 25% Cabernet
Sauvignon grapes from the right bank of
Bordeaux. offers excellent sott red and
black fruit flavours Rich in colour this wine
is elegantly structured with a good balance
st truit and tanninst eomnlements mostl
meat dishes and cheese.
Jamiesons Run Limestone Coast Chardonnay
2003
This award winnine South Australian wine is
vibrant straw yellow with a hint of green hue.
Rich flavours ot tropical truit. peach and
melon integrate very well with the buttery
oak characters. It goes well with many
seafood dishes particularly those with a
cream sauce
CX SIGNATURE DRINKS
PORT
CATHAY DELIGHT
A kiwifruit based non-alcoholic
drink with coconut juice and a
fouch of fresh mint.
PACIFIC SUNRISE
A refreshing combination of
champagne and Drambuie with
the zest of orange and lemon.
Dow's Late Bottled Vintage Port 1997
The 1997 Dow's Late Bottled Vintage Port has
won the "Kest Kusiness Class rortfied sweel
Wine" in the "Cellars in the Sky Awards 2004".
This wine is sourced from the same vineyards
that in exceptional years produce Dow's
renowned Vintage Ports. It is aged solely in oak
casks and bottled 5 to 6 years after the harvest.
It is a full rich Port with spicy fruit flavours and
an elegant aromatic nose, well rounded on the
palate and has the traditional Dow's drier
finish. This makes it one of the finest Late
Bottled Vintage Ports available.
